events.message: Customer reported a rear-end collision on the highway involving their vehicle and another car. Initial details were collected.
Claim was reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' based on the description of a car collision provided by the claimant.
An agent specialized in auto insurance claims was assigned to manage this case and coordinate further communication.
The claimant was sent an acknowledgment message confirming receipt of their accident claim and next steps to follow.
Requested police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and a detailed statement from the claimant regarding the accident.
Claimant submitted all requested documents including police report, vehicle photos, and a signed witness statement as evidence.
Auto claims investigation team began reviewing the provided materials and contacted involved parties for verification.
Investigation was concluded successfully finding the claimant not at fault, all documentation matched incident circumstances.
A settlement offer covering vehicle repairs and rental car expenses was proposed to the claimant based on investigation results.
Claimant responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the promptness and fairness of the proposed settlement offer.
Claim was officially approved by the insurance company after claimant accepted the proposed settlement terms.
Settlement payment was issued to the claimantâ€™s designated account to cover repair and related expenses.
The claim case was closed successfully with all matters resolved and no outstanding issues reported.
All claim documents and records were archived securely to maintain compliance and for possible future reference.
